results.title: Peninsular pioneers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Describes the country buildings of Arthur’s Seat or McCrae Cottage 1844, the Church of St James the Less 1865, Heronswood 1871, and Baragunda 1866.

results.title: Penicillin: the magic bullet
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn, Claire Jager and Arcimedia
results.brief_description: In 1945 the Nobel Prize for medicine was awarded to three men - Alexander Fleming, Ernst Chain, and the Australian, Howard Florey - as the inventors of penicillin, the “magic bullet” of medicine. This doumentary tells the true story behind the discovery of penicillin, the wonder drug of the twentieth century, which would change the face of modern civilisation by providing a cure for medical scourges such as pneumonia, meningitis, rheumatic fever, septicaemia and venereal diseases. Using dramatic re-enactments, “Penicillin : the magic bullet” charts the work of the Howard Florey’s team (including that of the overlooked Norman Heatley) as they struggled towards this medical breakthrough. Narrated by Martin Jacobs.

results.title: Penguin Island
results.brief_description: A film record of the various types of animal life found by the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition (1948-1950) during their stay on Macquarie Island. Shows many species of seals, penguins and birds, including the Great Wandering Albatross. Recordings of sounds made by penguins are used in the introduction to the film.

results.title: Pembrokeshire, my county
results.creator_credit: Ronald Stark, Andrew Rice and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A film on the Welsh country of Pembrokeshire,, through the seasons, showing the scenic beauty of the countryside, buildings of interest, and something of agriculture and social life of the country. Highlights of the film include shots of abundant wild life of the region, pleasures of sailing at Milford and unique scenes in the Cistercian monastery at Caldey Island.

results.title: Peiping family
results.creator_credit: William James, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Describes the daily life of a middle-class educated Chinese family in Peking including scenes of the children being taught in the family home by their mother who is a qualified teacher. This film was made prior to the declaration of the People’s Republic of China in 1949 and is seen through “western” eyes and “western” philosophy.

results.title: Pegged in
results.creator_credit: Michael Eaglesome, David Atkinson, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A handful of pegs get up to no good when the house lady leaves them alone with a basket full of freshly dried clothes. This student live animation is an excerise in punchline storytelling with a carefree humour and jazzy soundtrack.

results.title: Peer pressure, drugs and you
results.creator_credit: Robin Bossert, Carolyn Vanderslice, Bossert and Company and Sunburst Communications
results.brief_description: Using case studies and examples, this program demonstrates assertiveness strategies for resisting peer pressure to use drugs. The program is divided into three parts, with each part examining a different aspect of peer pressure. This program will facilitate role-playing and provide techniques and strategies for resisting peer pressure in a number of situations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin Bossert, Carolyn Vanderslice, Bossert and Company and Sunburst Communications

results.title: Peer pressure trigger tapes (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Three exciting short films about peer pressure, 1)”Sticks and Toby”. Two best friends, a thin boy and a fat boy go swimming. Toby , the fat boy, is teased by a group of boys who want Sticks to join them. What should Sticks do? “The Gang”; Ting Lee wants to join a gang at her school. In her new hairstyle and jacket they finally accept her, but then they pressure her to smoke! “Tough Rules” Max and his friends do lots of fun things together. One day they decide they should each steal something, Max doesn’t like stealing , but doesn’t want to lose his friends.

results.title: Peer culture
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores two worlds children must negotiate during middle childhood and adolescence; the authority of adults and the co-operation of peers. The nature of the peer group as a microsociety is analysed through a look at “los abandonados”, a homeless and parentless group of children in Guatemala City who live in a completely peer-organized world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

results.title: Peer conducted behaviour modification (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Steven D McAdam and Phillip R. Blake
results.brief_description: Drs. Clement and Paterson discuss the roles of peers in child therapy. The film shows a program at the Oregon Institute which, having found that the child’s peers can undermine the work of both psychologists and parents, uses other children to reinforce the behaviour therapy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven D McAdam and Phillip R. Blake
